title: BBC Local Live: Cambridgeshire on Thursday, 31 March 2016 - BBC News
summary: a report published by cambridgeshire county council into last month 's guided busway crash has come under fire by the emergency services for being `` inaccurate '' on timings .
businesses in soham say a new railway station would help `` transform '' the town .
nhs patients in the county say they 're worried about future staffing levels in hospitals , according to a public consultation .
more news , sport , travel and weather updates from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage for the day
text: that 's it from the team in cambridgeshire .
we 'll be back to do it all again tomorrow from 08:00 , but if you 'd like to get in touch or share a story you can do so via email , twitter or facebook .

documents.title: dog found dumped with throat slit
text: the rspca is appealing for information after a dog was found dumped near peterborough with its throat slit .
a dog walker found the body of the brindle and white lurcher dumped in undergrowth in a layby in holme road , yaxley , on tuesday .
rspca officer matthew johnson said since there was no blood in the area the dog would probably have been killed elsewhere before being dumped in the bushes .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire spread after cardboard box set alight , inquest hears
text: an inquest into the death of a couple has heard the house in somersham was cluttered and the fire took hold very quickly .
two carers were there at the time when the fire spread , killing roger freestone , 67 , and his wife maureen aged 65 .
mr freestone was seen kicking a cardboard box which had caught fire out the front door , but it ignited a curtain in the property and the fire quickly escalated .
the inquest in huntingdon has been adjourned until september .

documents.title: vomiting bug at addenbrooke 's
text: addenbrooke 's hospital is warning of visitor restrictions to stop norovirus spreading
visiting restrictions due to winter vomiting bug at addenbrooke 's

documents.title: man raped in cambridge
text: a man was raped in cambridge in the early hours of saturday morning .

police said the victim , in his 20s , was walking along akeman street away from histon road at about 01:15 when he was grabbed and restrained by one of two men , while the other sexually assaulted him .
one offender is white and about 6ft tall while the other is black and slightly shorter .
both were wearing dark coloured tracksuits and hoodies .
this is a serious incident which has had a significant impact on the victim .
i would urge anyone who may know who is responsible for this horrific crime , to contact police immediately .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : clear overnight with widespread frosts
text: any showers will soon die out this evening to leave a dry and clear night across all parts , although this will allow widespread frosts with fog patches in the fens .
temperatures will fall to about 2c , that 's 36f , and tomorrow will once again see plenty of sunshine .
weather has the latest local forecasts .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: headlines : man raped in cambridge inquest opens into death of couple who died in fire
text: the main news stories this afternoon :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: school 's deputy head pays tribute to fire service
text: matthew chancellor , deputy head at st bede 's inter-church school in cambridge where a classroom caught fire yesterday , said staff would `` working hard over the next two weeks '' to make sure it reopens after the easter holidays .
he also paid tribute to the fire service , saying : `` we are grateful they were able to contain the incident so quickly and limit the extent of the damage . ''
an investigation found the cause of the fire was accidental .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : peterborough 's nicholson suffers broken leg
text: peterborough united midfielder jordan nicholson is set to miss the remainder of the season after breaking his leg in training .
the 22-year-old has made just one appearance for the posh since joining from histon in the autumn .
posh manager graham westley says nicholson will spend around four weeks in a protective boot before returning to light training .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: lease signing a significant step forward for peterborough micro pub
text: what could become peterborough 's first micro pub has moved a step closer .
author: Peterborough Telegraph

documents.title: speedway : peterborough at full strength for premier league cup opener
text: peterborough panthers will track a full strength line-up when they face sheffield in the premier league cup later .
ulrich ostergaard captains the side , with simon lambert , michael palm toft and nickolas porsing all returning for another season .
panthers were due to start the new season on easter monday , but their fixture against ipswich at the showground was postponed due to overrunning engineering works .
author: Peter Swan
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire sport

documents.title: investigation reveals fire at st bede 's school was 'accidental '
text: an investigation into a fire at a school in cambridge has found the blaze was caused by accident .
more than 20 firefighters tackled the blaze which broke out yesterday at st bede 's inter-church school on birdwood road .
no-one was hurt .

cambridgeshire fire and rescue service said : `` due to the extent of the damage it is unclear how it was started , but we are not treating it as sus the school is due to reopen as planned after the holidays .

documents.title: amazon creates permanent jobs in peterborough
text: online retailer amazon says 400 people who worked at its peterborough fulfilment centre during the christmas period are to be offered permanent positions .
if the workers accept the posts , it will take the number of people employed there to more than 1,200 .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: couple died as husband tried to save bed-bound wife
text: an inquest has opened into the death of a couple from somersham , who died in house fire on easter monday .
the bodies of roger freestone , 67 , and his wife maureen , 65 , who was bed-bound , were found by firefighters as they tried to tackle a blaze at their home in queens road .
the hearing at lawrence court , huntingdon , was told mr freestone had tried to save his wife .
first reported in the hunts post , post-mortem examinations showed the pair died from smoke inhalation and carbon monoxide poisoning .
two carers in the house at the time managed to escape but one suffered minor burns .
the inquest will resume in september .

documents.title: railway reopening in soham would boost trade , claim businesses
text: local businesses say they have no doubt re-opening the railway station at soham would benefit the local economy .
sarah , who runs the little gift shop , told me the lack of connectivity means she has to drive her daughter daily to ely so she can catch a train to cambridge .

coffee shop owner nadia said she 's `` convinced the town needs it '' , while local estate agent , paul sawyer , said he 's often asked if there 's a railway station by potential buyers , many of whom chose to live near ely instead because of the transport link .
a feasibility study on the re-opening of the station is under way .
author: Tom Horn
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: soham station feasibility study given thumbs up by railway group
text: a railway campaign group has welcomed the proposal for a new railway station at soham .
railfuture east anglia says a long feasibility study is inevitable and because the route is already in use , there 's more to consider than just the re-opening of a station
it 's already a very busy freight route with passenger trains running on it and the other part of the project is to double the track between soham and ely because that is a real bottleneck . ''
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : mainly dry with sunny spells
text: it will be a mainly dry , fine afternoon with light winds and some good sunny spells , but one or two heavy or thundery showers may be possible .
top temperature of about 12c ( 54f ) .
bbc weather has more local details .
thanks to bbc weather watcher graham for this beautiful photo of southoe .

documents.title: headlines : council defends report into guided busway crash study under way over reopening of soham railway station
text: the lunchtime news :
author: Emma Maclean
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: major review of community facilities in cambridge prompts calls to spare them from cuts
text: a major review of community centres in cambridge is urging people to have their say .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: cause of somersham fire 'accidental '
text: the cause of a fire which killed two people earlier this week was `` accidental '' , according to cambridgeshire fire service .
it broke out at a property on queens road in somersham just before 20:00 on easter monday .
station commander carl pardon said the severity of the fire made it difficult to pinpoint the exact cause , but it 's not being treated as sus
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: travel : severe delays on the m11 northbound
text: travel are reporting severe delays on the m11 northbound at j11 for the a10 after a 4x4 overturned towing a trailer .
one lane is blocked and there are queues backing to j10 at duxford .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: fears water pouring into hauxton stream 'could be chemical waste '
text: investigations are being carried out at a stream in cambridgeshire amid fears chemical waste could be pouring into it .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: soham railway station study looks to assess benefits of it reopening
text: a feasibility study is being carried out to assess the benefits of soham railway station reopening .
it has been commissioned by cambridgeshire county council and east cambridgeshire district council to investigate what work must be done to make it a reality .
the town 's former station closed in 1965 .
author: Sam Edwards
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: council says ambulance arrival times to crash 'accurately recorded on cctv '
text: a report detailing arrival times for the emergency services to last month 's guided busway crash have been defended by the county council .
the authority 's report has come under fire by all the emergency services , which claim they responded to the crash near trumpington much quicker than was stated .
cambridgeshire county council says the times were `` recorded on our cctv cameras covering this section of the busway '' .
but it admits the ambulance service may have turned up earlier , as paramedics arrived on foot and may not have been up on the cameras .
`` since this incident there have been discussions with the services to see if any changes are needed to the emergency protocols , '' the council added .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel news : delays on a14
text: an accident on the eastbound a14 at j27 for fenstanton is causing delays to drivers , with one lane blocked .
congestion back to j24 for godmanchester .
travel has the latest .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: 'more imagination ' called for to combat thousands of extra cars coming into west cambridge
text: cambridge university has been urged to be `` more imaginative '' in its efforts to solve the ensuing traffic chaos when thousands of extra cars are added to a gridlocked route into the city .
author: Cambridge News

documents.title: guided busway crash report 'inaccurate ' on emergency services arrival timings
text: a report by cambridgeshire county council into last month 's guided busway crash , where a number of people were hurt , has come under fire by the emergency services for being `` inaccurate '' on timings .
the document says police took 31 minutes to get to the scene , a first responder ambulance took 51 minutes and the fire service took 40 minutes .
but the emergency services dispute the timings , saying they arrived 23 , 13 and 26 minutes after the call-out .
two passengers on the bus that day told me they were also surprised with the report 's suggestion it took so long for them to arrive .
we 'll bring you what the county council has had to say on the matter shortly .
author: Jozef Hall
BBC Radio Cambridgeshire

documents.title: consultation concludes county 's nhs need to be 'better integrated '
text: nhs services in cambridgeshire and peterborough need to be better integrated , according to one of cambridgeshire 's health commissioners .

dr alex gimson 's conclusion follows a public consultation which highlighted a number of issues , including patient concerns about under-funding in mental health services and hospital staffing levels .
the nhs in cambridgeshire and peterborough is expected to be £ 150m in deficit this year .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : guided busway crash report 'inaccurate ' on timings soham businesses say new railway station would 'transform ' town
text: the main news stories this morning :
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car fire closes road in march
text: police are warning of a road closure after a car caught fire .
st. peters road march closed between the causeway and elwyn road .
due to car fire .

documents.title: weather : sunny spells and mostly dry
text: today will see good spells of sunshine with just the small chance of a shower .
temperatures reaching 11c ( 52f ) .
bbc weather has the latest where you live .
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: hello and welcome to cambridgeshire live
text: between now and 18:00 we 'll bring you news , sport , travel and weather updates as we get them .
we 're always interested in what 's happening in your part of the county , so if there 's anything you wish to share , contact us on email , facebook or twitter .
author: Mariam Issimdar
BBC Local Live
